parts.text:
```json
{"application": "Meso-NH", "software": ["mpirun", "nqsII/qsub", "scp", "ssh", "ln", "mkdir", "cp", "cat", "rsh"], "modules": [], "environment_variables": {"TPN": "1", "NBP": "1", "TIME": "3600", "MEM": "3Gb", "MNH_EXP": "MNH_EXP", "MPIRUN": "mpirun -nn ${NBP} -nnp ${TPN}", "MONORUN": "mpirun -nn 1 -nnp 1", "CAT": "cat", "SUBDIR": "${PWD}/${CONFEXP}", "EXECDIR": "${TMPDIR}", "LINKFILES": "ln -sf ", "INDIR": "INDIR", "OUTDIR": "${INDIR}", "GETFILES": "ln -s ", "RMINDIR": "${INDIR}", "OUTHOST": "${INHOST}", "PUTFILES": "cp -p", "RMMKDIR": "mkdir -p", "RMOUTDIR": "${OUTDIR}", "RMSHELL": "rsh yuki -n ", "QSUB": "/usr/bin/nqsII/qsub", "JOBMONO": "#PBS -S /bin/ksh             # ligne obligatoire specifiant le shell: ksh ou csh\n#PBS -q vector                # classe multiple\n#PBS -N R`basename  $PWD`    # noms requete\n#PBS -l cpunum_job=${TPN}    # réservation de 4 processeurs (max=8)\n#PBS -b ${NBP}\n#PBS -j o                    # concatene la sortie standard avec l erreur standard\n#PBS -l cputim_job=${TIME}      # temps max (HH:MM:SS)/job\n#PBS -l memsz_job=${MEM}        # memoire max /job\n", "JOBMULTI": "#PBS -S /bin/ksh             # ligne obligatoire specifiant le shell: ksh ou csh\n#PBS -q vector                # classe multiple\n#PBS -N R`basename  $PWD`    # noms requete\n#PBS -l cpunum_job=${TPN}    # réservation de 4 processeurs (max=8)\n#PBS -b ${NBP}\n#PBS -j o                    # concatene la sortie standard avec l erreur standard\n#PBS -l cputim_job=${TIME}      # temps max (HH:MM:SS)/job\n#PBS -l memsz_job=${MEM}        # memoire max /job\n", "PREP_PGD_FILES": "/cnrm/ge/mrmh/mrmh005/mesonh/PGD", "OUT_CPGDFILE": "OUT_CPGDFILE", "INP_CPGDFILE_FATHER": "INP_CPGDFILE_FATHER", "INP_YPGD1": "INP_YPGD1", "INP_YPGD2": "INP_YPGD2", "INP_YPGD3": "INP_YPGD3", "INP_YPGD4": "INP_YPGD4", "LISTGET": "LISTGET", "CRT_YNEST": "CRT_YNEST", "OUT_YPGD1_NEST": "OUT_YPGD1_NEST", "OUT_YPGD2_NEST": "OUT_YPGD2_NEST", "LISTE_PUT": "LISTE_PUT", "INDIR_HATMFILE": "${RMINDIR}", "INP_HATMFILE": "INP_HATMFILE", "SUF": "SUF", "INP_HPGDFILE": "INP_HPGDFILE", "INP_CFILE": "INP_CFILE", "OUT_CINIFILE": "OUT_CINIFILE", "INP_YDOMAIN": "INP_YDOMAIN", "INP_CINIFILE": "INP_CINIFILE", "OUT_CINIFILE_SPA": "OUT_CINIFILE_SPA", "INP_CINIFILE1": "INP_CINIFILE1", "INP_CINIFILE2": "INP_CINIFILE2", "CRT_CEXP": "CRT_CEXP", "CRT_CSEG": "CRT_CSEG", "OUT_XFMOUT": "OUT_XFMOUT", "INP_YINIFILE": "INP_YINIFILE", "CRT_YSUFFIX": "CRT_YSUFFIX", "OUT_DIAG": "OUT_DIAG", "CRT_CVYSUFFIX": "CRT_CVYSUFFIX", "OUT_CVFILE": "OUT_CVFILE", "INP_FILE1": "INP_FILE1", "NOVISU": "!", "OUT_GMFILE": "OUT_GMFILE"}, "resources": {"gres": null, "cpus_per_task": null, "tasks": null, "ntasks_per_code": null, "gpus": null, "gpus_per_node": null, "cores_per_socket": null, "gpus_per_task": null, "exclusive": null, "cpus_per_gpu": null, "gpu_type": null, "time": "3600", "ntasks_per_node": null, "nodes": null, "memory": "3Gb", "sockets_per_node": null, "ntasks_per_socket": null, "mem_per_gpu": null, "mem_per_cpu": null, "gres_flags": null}, "versions": {}}
```

The script is for running the **Meso-NH** weather model. It defines a number of environment variables related to:

* **Job parameters:**  `TPN` (number of processors), `NBP` (number of processes), `TIME` (maximum run time), `MEM` (maximum memory), `MNH_EXP` (experiment name).
* **Execution environment:** `SUBDIR` (subdirectory), `EXECDIR` (execution directory).
* **Data transfer:** `INDIR`, `OUTDIR` (input/output directories), `GETFILES`, `PUTFILES` (transfer commands), `RMINDIR`, `RMOUTDIR` (commands to remove directories).
* **Job submission:** `RMSHELL`, `QSUB` (commands for submitting jobs).
* **Input/output file names:** Various variables defining the filenames for different stages of the simulation (e.g., `PREP_PGD_FILES`, `OUT_CPGDFILE`, `INP_CINIFILE`, etc.). 

The script also includes PBS-specific directives for setting up job resources (CPU, memory, queue). 

The script appears to handle data transfer using a variety of methods, including:

* **Default:** Uses `FTDIR` for transferring files.
* **SSH:** Transfers files via SSH when `INHOST` or `OUTHOST` includes an '@' symbol.
* **Workdir:** Transfers files from/to `WORKDIR`.

The script provides a comprehensive setup for running Meso-NH, with a lot of flexibility in terms of data transfer and job submission.
